title: 【突發行動】 929遊行前奏支持FA，人道救援誓師大會！

replies.msg:
929《人道救援誓師大會》


活動當日詳情：

活動時間：12:30-14:00
集合地點：世貿對出空地(sogo後門）
Dresscode: 反光衣/黑口罩/黑色衫
對象：
- 全港所有醫療專職人員及
- 前線義務急救員

活動內容：
朗讀宣言
- 重申醫療救護專業
- 譴責警察濫暴及濫捕急救員
- 聲援被捕醫謢及急救員


聲明：

我們是一群來自前線義務急救員及醫療界別的人士，本著有「救」無類的初心，無論病人的年齡、疾病、殘疾、信仰、國族、性別、國籍、政見、種族、地位或性向，我們都一視同仁、盡全力搶救。

唯六月至今，警隊多次濫用武力殘害市民，向無反抗能力或已被制伏的示威者施以酷刑，遠超行動目標的範圍。警方多次阻止消防處指派的救護員進行人道救援工作，歪曲事實指義務急救員為假醫護，更無理將其拘捕，亦漠視受傷市民接受治療的權利，對被捕市民的就醫安排諸多阻礙，更涉嫌行使私刑嚴重傷害市民身體，甚至濫捕在場急救員，嚴重違反國際人道法。種種行為構成重大的人道危機，是香港文明社會的災難。更令部分參與救援手足之救援成本嚴重增加， 自身安全亦受到嚴重威脅。

我們在此鄭重地宣誓，每一位於衝突現場出現的前線義務急救員，都秉持著人道救援的原則。我們憑我們之良心及尊嚴從事醫療救援工作。即使在威脅之下，我們亦不會運用我們的醫學知識去違反人權和民權。

我們亦希望在此聲援被捕醫謢及急救人員，並拒絕白色恐怖於救援工作中蔓延。每位前線義務急救員或醫療界的人士，絕對以尊重生命為依歸。救急扶傷是醫護人員的天職。我們再次嚴重譴責警察罔顧人道精神、缺乏人倫道德，違法國際人道法，使救護工作再受到侵蝕。

一群堅決捍衛救護專業之醫療急救人員

929 Oath-Taking Assembly for Humanitarian Aid


Details of the Assembly:

Time: 12:30pm
Venue: the open area opposite to World Trade Centre; the back entrance of SOGO
Dresscode: Safety vests, black masks, or any black clothing

Expected participants:
- ALL medical professionals
- fron-tline voluntary first-aiders

Rundown for the Assembly:
- Announcing the oath for humanitarian aid
- Re-emphasising the professionalism of medical practitioners
- Condemning police brutality and discriminate arrests of first-aiders
- Supporting arrested medical professionals

Declaration

We are a group of voluntary first-aiders and medical professionals at the frontline. We started with a strong will of life-saving-for-all, regardless of the patients’ age, types of illnesses and disabilities, religion, nation; nor their gender, nationality, political inclination, race, social status and sexual orientation. We treat them all equal, and we spare no effort into saving any lives. Nonetheless, since early June, Hong Kong Police Force (HKPF) have repeatedly adopted unnecessary violence to a fatal level and abused protesters with illegal punishment for sole purpose of severely hurting them. On 28 July, HKPF arrested and charged Wing-ki Chan, a nurse who was present in the scene assisting in humanitarian aid, with ‘rioting’. This is totally unacceptable that it arouses nothing but anger among us. On 21 September, in the course of demonstration in Tuen Mun, HKPF targeted especially at the front-line voluntary first-aiders to mislead the public into misunderstanding the nature of ambulance work, hinder them from providing medical aid, and even arrest them without any valid proofs for alleged offences. All these acts by HKPF are seriously violating the International Humanitarian Law. With such behaviors of HKPF, the costs of our medical fellows saving lives could only expect sharp rises, or they even need to risk their own safety in the crises.

We solemnly swear that every front-line volunteer who is present at the scene of the conflict adheres to the principles of humanitarian aid. We engage in humanitarian aid with our conscience and dignity. Even under threats, we will not use our medical knowledge to violate human rights and civil liberties.

We also hope to support the arrested medical and first-aid personnel, and refuse to spread white terror in humanitarian aid. Every frontline volunteer first-aider or medical personnel prioritize life above all else. Aiding those who are injured is the mission of all medical staff. Once again, we severely condemn the police for their disregard for humanitarian spirit, lack of human morality, and breach of International Humanitarian Law, which have eroded the integrity of medical work.

A group of medical and first-aid personnel who firmly defend medical professionalism
